did.unittitle:
William Robertson McKenney papers 1865-1930 and undated
(bulk 1880-1900)
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Lawyer, of Petersburg, Va. Materials relating to McKenney's law practice (chiefly 1880-1900), and largely concerned with the settlement of estates and the sale of real estate in Petersburg, Va.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], William Robertson McKenney Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The William Robertson McKenney Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library in 1947.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession from 1947 is described in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The William Robertson McKenney Papers span the years 1865-1930. McKenney was born in Petersburg in 1851 and attended the University of Virginia. The materials relate to McKenney's law practice (chiefly 1880-1900), and are largely concerned with the settlement of estates and the sale of real estate in Petersburg, Va. McKenney died in 1916.

did.unittitle: Professional Papers Series, 1865-1930 and undated, bulk 1880-1900
